definition: anecdote/fantastic story
odd (number)
strange/odd/weird/wonderful/surprisingly/unusually
surname Wen
to hear/news/well-known/famous/reputation/fame/to smell/to sniff at

sentences.english: no little anecdotes to share with the folks?
sentences.chinese: 就沒些個奇聞異事要跟家裏人分享的？

sentences.english: Once the story got abroad, I would never hear the last of it.
sentences.chinese: 要是這個奇聞一旦傳了出去，就會討論個沒完沒了。

sentences.english: Other oddities leak out from the books and the memoirs.
sentences.chinese: 還有一些奇聞逸事從書本和回憶錄中泄露出來。

sentences.english: Mr Ramo uses his anecdotes to make some sharp observations.
sentences.chinese: 藍默先生利用這些奇聞軼事建構出的觀察相當犀利。

sentences.english: These humble shepherds were the first to hear and ponder the wondrous news of the birth of Christ.
sentences.chinese: 謙和的牧民們第一次聽到並思索着基督誕世之奇聞。

sentences.english: They sat around the campfire telling tall tales about their hunting adventures.
sentences.chinese: 他們圍坐在篝火旁講着自己狩獵冒險的奇聞。

sentences.english: Mr Ramo’s book is full of engaging vignettes like this.
sentences.chinese: 藍默先生的新書博引旁徵這番引人入勝的奇聞逸事。

sentences.english: In 1859, such reports were mostly curiosities.
sentences.chinese: 1859年，這樣的報道大多數是奇聞。

sentences.english: Looking into strange and extraordinary stories of ancient times is very interesting.
sentences.chinese: 鉤稽古代奇聞軼事是一件很有趣的事。

definition: false alarm/panic rumor/CL:場|场[chang2]
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds

dramatic form consisting of historical narration/history as jocular narrative/to stretch history for a joking story/amusing story with strained interpretations of history/to make an unreasonable comparison in jest
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
root of Chinese pulsatilla/Chinese bulbul
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
(idiom) (of a good outcome) unanticipated/serendipitous/fortuitous
feast/celebration
variant of 閒談|闲谈[xian2 tan2]
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
to touch base matter and turn it to gold (idiom); fig. to turn crude writing into a literary gem
lit. don't fight, won't make friends (idiom); an exchange of blows may lead to friendship/no discord, no concord
lit. dragons and snakes mingle (idiom)/fig. a mix of good people and scumbags
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
